subcommands.name: denoise-ccs
subcommands.description: Denoise and dereplicate single-end Pacbio CCS

options.description: The single-end demultiplexed PacBio CCS sequences to be denoised. [required]

Sequence of an adapter ligated to the 5' end. The adapter and any preceding bases are trimmed. Can contain IUPAC ambiguous nucleotide codes. Note, primer direction is 5' to 3'. Primers are removed before trim and filter step. Reads that do not contain the primer are discarded. Each read is re-oriented if the reverse complement of the read is a better match to the provided primer sequence. This is recommended for PacBio CCS reads, which come in a random mix of forward and reverse-complement orientations. [required]

Sequence of an adapter ligated to the 3' end. The adapter and any preceding bases are trimmed. Can contain IUPAC ambiguous nucleotide codes. Note, primer direction is 5' to 3'. Primers are removed before trim and filter step. Reads that do not contain the primer are discarded. [required]
The number of mismatches to tolerate when matching reads to primer sequences - see http://benjjneb.github.io/dada2/ for complete details. [default: 2]
Allow insertions or deletions of bases when matching adapters. Note that primer matching can be significantly slower, currently about 4x slower

Position at which sequences should be truncated due to decrease in quality. This truncates the 3' end of the of the input sequences, which will be the bases that were sequenced in the last cycles. Reads that are shorter than this value will be discarded. If 0 is provided, no truncation or length filtering will be performed. Note: Since Pacbio CCS sequences were normally with very high quality scores, there is no need to truncate the Pacbio CCS sequences.
Position at which sequences should be trimmed due to low quality. This trims the 5' end of the of the input sequences, which will be the bases that were sequenced in the first cycles. [default: 0]
Reads with number of expected errors higher than this value will be discarded. [default: 2.0]
Reads are truncated at the first instance of a quality score less than or equal to this value. If the resulting read is then shorter than `trunc-len`, it is discarded. [default: 2]
Remove reads with length less than minLen. minLen is enforced after trimming and truncation. For 16S Pacbio CCS, suggest 1000. [default: 20]
Remove reads prior to trimming or truncation which are longer than this value. If 0 is provided no reads will be removed based on length. For 16S Pacbio CCS, suggest 1600. [default: 0]

The method used to pool samples for denoising. "independent": Samples are denoised indpendently. "pseudo": The pseudo-pooling method is used to approximate pooling of samples. In short, samples are denoised independently once, ASVs detected in at least 2 samples are recorded, and samples are denoised independently a second time, but this time with prior knowledge of the recorded ASVs and thus higher sensitivity to those ASVs.

The method used to remove chimeras. "none": No chimera removal is performed. "pooled": All reads are pooled prior to chimera detection. "consensus": Chimeras are detected in samples individually, and sequences found chimeric in a sufficient fraction of samples are removed. [default: 'consensus']

The minimum abundance of potential parents of a sequence being tested as chimeric, expressed as a fold-change versus the abundance of the sequence being tested. Values should be greater than or equal to 1 (i.e. parents should be more abundant than the sequence being tested). Suggest 3.5. This parameter has no effect if chimera-method is "none".

Bimeras that are one-off from exact are also identified if the `allow-one-off` argument is True. If True, a sequence will be identified as bimera if it is one mismatch or indel away from an exact bimera. [default: False]
The number of threads to use for multithreaded processing. If 0 is provided, all available cores will be used. [default: 1]
The number of reads to use when training the error model. Smaller numbers will result in a shorter run time but a less reliable error model.

If true, the feature ids in the resulting table will be presented as hashes of the sequences defining each feature. The hash will always be the same for the same sequence so this allows feature tables to be merged across runs of this method. You should only merge tables if the exact same parameters are used for each run. [default: True]
The resulting feature table. [required]
The resulting feature sequences. Each feature in the feature table will be represented by exactly one sequence. [required]
[required]
Output unspecified results to a directory
Display verbose output to stdout and/or stderr during execution of this action. Or silence output if execution is successful (silence is golden).

subcommands.name: denoise-paired
subcommands.description: Denoise and dereplicate paired-end sequences

options.description: ARTIFACT SampleData[PairedEndSequencesWithQuality] The paired-end demultiplexed sequences to be denoised. [required]

Position at which forward read sequences should be truncated due to decrease in quality. This truncates the 3' end of the of the input sequences, which will be the bases that were sequenced in the last cycles. Reads that are shorter than this value will be discarded. After this parameter is applied there must still be at least a 12 nucleotide overlap between the forward and reverse reads. If 0 is provided, no truncation or length filtering will be performed

Position at which reverse read sequences should be truncated due to decrease in quality. This truncates the 3' end of the of the input sequences, which will be the bases that were sequenced in the last cycles. Reads that are shorter than this value will be discarded. After this parameter is applied there must still be at least a 12 nucleotide overlap between the forward and reverse reads. If 0 is provided, no truncation or length filtering will be performed

Position at which forward read sequences should be trimmed due to low quality. This trims the 5' end of the input sequences, which will be the bases that were sequenced in the first cycles. [default: 0]

Position at which reverse read sequences should be trimmed due to low quality. This trims the 5' end of the input sequences, which will be the bases that were sequenced in the first cycles. [default: 0]
Forward reads with number of expected errors higher than this value will be discarded. [default: 2.0]
Reverse reads with number of expected errors higher than this value will be discarded. [default: 2.0]

Reads are truncated at the first instance of a quality score less than or equal to this value. If the resulting read is then shorter than `trunc-len-f` or `trunc-len-r` (depending on the direction of the read) it is discarded. [default: 2]

The method used to pool samples for denoising. "independent": Samples are denoised indpendently. "pseudo": The pseudo-pooling method is used to approximate pooling of samples. In short, samples are denoised independently once, ASVs detected in at least 2 samples are recorded, and samples are denoised independently a second time, but this time with prior knowledge of the recorded ASVs and thus higher sensitivity to those ASVs.

The method used to remove chimeras. "none": No chimera removal is performed. "pooled": All reads are pooled prior to chimera detection. "consensus": Chimeras are detected in samples individually, and sequences found chimeric in a sufficient fraction of samples are removed. [default: 'consensus']

The minimum abundance of potential parents of a sequence being tested as chimeric, expressed as a fold-change versus the abundance of the sequence being tested. Values should be greater than or equal to 1 (i.e. parents should be more abundant than the sequence being tested). This parameter has no effect if chimera-method is "none". [default: 1.0]

Bimeras that are one-off from exact are also identified if the `allow-one-off` argument is TrueIf True, a sequence will be identified as bimera if it is one mismatch or indel away from an exact bimera.
The number of threads to use for multithreaded processing. If 0 is provided, all available cores will be used. [default: 1]
The number of reads to use when training the error model. Smaller numbers will result in a shorter run time but a less reliable error model.

If true, the feature ids in the resulting table will be presented as hashes of the sequences defining each feature. The method used to pool samples for denoising. "independent": Samples are denoised independently. "pseudo": The pseudo-pooling method is used to approximate pooling of samples. In short, samples are denoised independently once, ASVs detected in at least 2 samples are recorded, and samples are denoised independently a second time, but this time with prior knowledge of the recorded ASVs and thus higher sensitivity to those ASVs.

The method used to remove chimeras. "none": No chimera removal is performed. "pooled": All reads are pooled prior to chimera detection. "consensus": Chimeras are detected in samples individually, and sequences found chimeric in a sufficient fraction of samples are removed. [default: 'consensus']

The minimum abundance of potential parents of a sequence being tested as chimeric, expressed as a fold-change versus the abundance of the sequence being tested. Values should be greater than or equal to 1 (i.e. parents should be more abundant than the sequence being tested). This parameter has no effect if chimera-method is "none". [default: 1.0]

Bimeras that are one-off from exact are also identified if the `allow-one-off` argument is True.If True, a sequence will be identified as bimera if it is one mismatch or indel away from an exact bimera.
The number of threads to use for multithreaded processing. If 0 is provided, all available cores will be used. [default: 1]
The number of reads to use when training the error model. Smaller numbers will result in a shorter run time but a less reliable error model.

If true, the feature ids in the resulting table will be presented as hashes of the sequences defining each feature. The hash will always be the same for the same sequence so this allows feature tables to be merged across runs of this method. You should only merge tables if the exact same parameters are used for each run. [default: True]
The resulting feature table. [required]
The resulting feature sequences. Each feature in the feature table will be represented by exactly one sequence. [required]

Dimensions to reduce the distance matrix to. This number determines how many eigenvectors and eigenvalues are returned,and influences the choice of algorithm used to compute them. options.description: Query Sequences. [required]

Pre-trained sklearn taxonomic classifier for classifying the reads. [required]

Maximum number of hits to keep for each query. Set to "all" to keep all hits > perc-identity similarity. Note that if strand=both, maxaccepts will keep N hits for each direction (if searches in the opposite direction yield results that exceed the minimum perc-identity). In those cases use maxhits to control the total number of hits returned. This option works in pair with maxrejects. The search process sorts target sequences by decreasing number of k-mers they have in common with the query sequence, using that information as a proxy for sequence similarity. After pairwise alignments, if the first target sequence passes the acceptation criteria, it is accepted as best hit and the search process stops for that query. If maxaccepts is set to a higher value, more hits are accepted. If maxaccepts and maxrejects are both set to "all", the complete database is searched. [default: 10]

Percent sequence similarity to use for PREFILTER. Reject match if percent identity to query is lower. Set to a lower value to perform a rough pre-filter. This parameter is ignored if `prefilter` is disabled. [default: 0.5]
